page.title: 14Road Traffic,Local Concern
page.content: In 1984 the a 422 had an average daily traffic flow of 7670 vehicles,12.5% of these were heavy goods vehicles.It also had an accident rate much higher than other principal roads in the county.A By-Pass for Bromham on the A 428 is currently under construction and on completion,it is felt locally,will mean that traffic will reach Stagsden village travelling much faster trhan at present, despite the 2 bends at the centre.A By-Pass for Stagsden is proposed for 1989/90.The public were consulted on 4 possible routes.The 2 northern routes meant loss of much agricultural land, Bird Gardens and severance of the community.53% of the public favoured the southern route (the selected route),which also took less agricultural land and had less impact on the countryside.
